newsitem.title: USA: Basin group makes Eugene Island discovery.
newsitem.headline: Basin group makes Eugene Island discovery.

text.p: Basin Exploration Inc said Thursday it is operator for a group that made a natural gas/condensate discovery on Eugene Island Block 65, located in shallow waters offshore Louisiana in the Gulf of Mexico.

The discovery well, Eugene Island 65 OCS-G 16343 1, has been directionally drilled to a true vertical subsea depth of 13,221 feet. The well encountered an estimated 111 net feet of gas/condensate pay in two primary-objective Miocene sands, as determined from electric and other logs, Basin said.
No zones have been tested in the well, which has been cased to the depth drilled, it continued.

The drilling rig remains on location and Basin and its partners intend to resume drilling to test an additional, secondary-objective sand about 1,600 feet deeper. Field development plans will be formulated after the well has reached total depth, Basin said.

Basin has a a 37.5 percent working interest in the project before payout and 47.5 percent interest after payout. Other owners include Ashland Inc, Forest Oil Corp and Hall-Houston Oil Co. ((-- Jim Brumm 212-859-1710.))
